formName: First draft of Journey selector tool for AEO

sections.title: Which AEO status is your business applying for?

fields.label: Which AEO status is your business applying for?
optionHelpText: Your business must be able to show it has staff with the experience or qualifications to deal with customs activities
Your business must  be able to show it has security standards in place for its customs activities
Your business must also be able to show it has both experienced or qualified staff, and security standards in place for its customs activities

fields.infoText:
You need to complete all of the forms on this page.  
 
We save your progress for **28 days**, starting from when you select the first link.  
 
When you are ready, you must submit all forms at the same time.

[C117](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C117-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator/nonagent?gac=cd886458-7579-4be7-a5de-afc163d8a564)  - Business and customs addresses, activity and audited accounts, responsible people

Upload audited accounts for last 3 years of trading - PDF or jpeg (5MB maximum)

[C118-1-1](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-1-part-1/nonagent?gac=da44af2b-c98b-48c0-b3c2-1ae6a3882cb9) - Audits, internal structure and reorganisation, company and third party locations

[C118-1-2](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-1-part-2/nonagent?gac=7488a7c4-3c1f-4e45-adfd-1c4dfcd6926f) - Volume of business, annual turnover and accounts, declarations estimates, duty and VAT

[C118-1-3](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-1-part-3/nonagent?gac=2708a0a5-2740-464a-afb2-cd9eeb0c0e8b) - Customs formalities, tariff classifications, value and certification, plus anti-dumping or countervailing duties

[C118-2](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-2/nonagent?gac=73a97f5d-8fe0-4ba7-b6b8-25f7767077f9) - Compliance record, convictions and customs authorisation

[C118-3-1](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-3-part-1/nonagent?gac=af5eb146-e193-42dd-a2ab-5ea9460aaaa0) - Audit trail, internal control system, flow of goods, stocktaking checks, recent customs routes audit report

Upload a recent customs routes audit report - PDF or jpeg (5MB maximum)

[C118-3-2](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-3-part-2/nonagent?gac=524cd6be-7f7d-41ec-907d-0990b00aba16) -  Customs routines, computer system back-up and protection, security documentation and compliance

[C118-4](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-4/nonagent?gac=c9b9dba2-065d-43f1-b46f-4bb6800c5de2) - Financial solvency and standing, Duty Deferment accounts, approved cash flow, balance sheet and profit/loss forecasts

If established in last 3 years, provide latest cash flow, balance sheet and profit and loss forecasts approved by directors, partners, sole proprietor - upload in PDF or jpeg (5MB maximum)

[C118-5](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-5/nonagent?gac=25cfca8b-5f70-4227-9903-618cf66ada0f) - Customs competence expert, their professional qualifications, training and European Standardisation compliance

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-5
fields.infoText:
**Person in charge of customs competence and professional qualifications details**, including:





- demonstration of 3 years of practical experience


- how they comply with a European Standardisation quality standard 


- where they got their qualifications, plus any other training

sections.title: Apply for AEO security and safety

fields.infoText:
You need to complete all of the forms on this page.  
  
We save your progress for **28 days**, starting from when you select the first link.  
  
When you are ready, you must submit all forms at the same time.

fields.label: infoAdvice
fields.infoText:
To help complete everything in time:  
- you can start and save any form in any order
- authorised people in your business can work on different forms at the same time, using the same Government Gateway ID and password
##Forms you need to complete

[C117](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C117-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator/nonagent?gac=cd886458-7579-4be7-a5de-afc163d8a564) - Business and customs addresses, activity and audited accounts, and responsible people

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C117
fields.infoText:
**Detail about the business**, including:
- all business addresses, including where you keep customs identification and documentation
- legal registration number
- VAT registered number
- any group your business is part of, including if they’ve applied for AEO authorisation

**Detail about the people**, including:
- name, address and email of person responsible for customs matters
- name, position, telephone number and email of designated contact person
- name, address, position, date of birth and National Insurance number for person in charge of company or control of management contact

**Detail about the business activity**, including:
- EU member states, ports and customs offices you use to import, export, or transit goods
- simplifications or facilitations your business has, with the type, code and authorisation numbers
- any certificates it holds mentioned in article 28 of Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2015/2447
- upload audited accounts for last 3 years of trading - PDF or jpeg (5MB maximum)

[C118-1-1](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-1-part-1/nonagent?gac=da44af2b-c98b-48c0-b3c2-1ae6a3882cb9) - Internal structure, business ownership and management, and third party locations

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-1-1
fields.infoText:
**Business information details**, including:


- any AEO authorisation or current audits of other companies in your group

- if your company was established in the last 3 years from internal reorganisation

- who is in charge of your business, or has control over the management

- names of your senior management, and their roles

- who your shareholders, directors and managers are, including how many shares they own;
  - for UK nationals, tell us their name and National Insurance number
  - for non-UK nationals, tell us their name, date of birth and residential address
  

- who is responsible for customs matters, their name and National Insurance number, and place of birth if non-UK national


- company locations, including employee numbers and business activity


- any third party locations where outsourced work takes place


- internal organisation structure and responsibilities of each department

[C118-1-2](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-1-part-2/nonagent?gac=7488a7c4-3c1f-4e45-adfd-1c4dfcd6926f) - Volume of business, annual turnover and accounts, declarations estimates, duty and VAT

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-1-2
fields.infoText:
**Volume of business details**, including:

* annual turnover figures for the last 3 sets of completed annual accounts
* annual net profit or loss figure for the last 3 sets of completed annual accounts
* any storage facilities you use which are owned by others
* estimates for each of the last 3 years of:
   * number and value of import declarations  
    * number and value of import/re-export declarations  
     * number and value of the special procedures declarations  
     * customs duty paid  
     * excise amount paid  
    * import VAT paid




* any changes you foresee in the next 2 years to:
   * structure
    * supply chain

[C118-1-3](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-1-part-3/nonagent?gac=2708a0a5-2740-464a-afb2-cd9eeb0c0e8b) - Customs formalities, tariff classifications, value and certification, plus anti-dumping or countervailing duties

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-1-3
fields.infoText:
**Business customs matters details**, including:

- who performs customs formalities, including EORI
- if you represent anyone else for customs formalities, and who these clients are
- how you decide tariff classification of goods, who does this, and how you make sure these are correct
- how you decide customs value, and make sure this is correct
- any overview of preferential or non-preferential origin of imported goods
- how you verify the country of origin for goods
- how you issue proof of preferences and certificates for origin for exportation
- any goods subject to anti-dumping or countervailing duties, plus details of manufacturers or countries outside EU whose goods are subject to these duties

[C118-2](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-2/nonagent?gac=73a97f5d-8fe0-4ba7-b6b8-25f7767077f9) - Compliance record, convictions and customs authorisation

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-2
fields.infoText:
**Compliance record, convictions and customs authorisation details**, including:





- any breaches of customs and taxation rules in the last 3 years


- how you notified government authorities of breaches


- what measures you brought in to avoid these in future


- any convictions and sentencing for serious infringement of criminal laws relating to economic activity


- any other customs authorisation you’ve applied for, or plan to apply for


- any applications turned down, or existing authorisations suspended or revoked, due to breaches of customs rules in last 3 years

[C118-3-1](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-3-part-1/nonagent?gac=af5eb146-e193-42dd-a2ab-5ea9460aaaa0) - Audit trail, internal control system, flow of goods, stocktaking checks, recent customs routes audit report

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-3-1
fields.infoText:
**Audit trail, internal control System, and flow of goods details**, including:



- how your accounting system allows an audit trail of customs activities and tax


- what computer system you use for business and for customers matters


- how your computer system is integrated, and what separation of functions there is


- who has access to the system


- what traceability there is between business and declaration systems 


- how systems distinguish between EU and non-EU goods, and show the location


- where computer activities take place, and if they’re outsourced


- what in-house guidelines exist for internal control system in the accounts department, buying department, sales department, customs department, production, material and merchandise management and logistics


- how you check computer files and avoid incorrect information


- how your registration procedure tracks and records the flow of goods


- how you handle checks and discrepancies for stocktaking and inventory


- upload any recent internal control system audit report - PDF or JPEG (5MB maximum)

[C118-3-2](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-3-part-2/nonagent?gac=524cd6be-7f7d-41ec-907d-0990b00aba16) -  Customs routines, computer system back-up and protection, security documentation and compliance

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-3-2
fields.infoText:
**Customs routines, back-up and protection of computer systems, and security documentation details**, including:





- how you document checking customs declaration accuracy


- how you document irregularities and notify authorities


- how you deal with licences for goods


- how you implement and update compliance procedures


- how you deal with business records, system failure, and access rights


- security incidents, unauthorised access and IT guidelines for staff


- security of the main server


- what security requirements you have for trade partners using your information

[C118-4](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-4/nonagent?gac=c9b9dba2-065d-43f1-b46f-4bb6800c5de2) - Financial solvency and standing, Duty Deferment accounts, approved cash flow, balance sheet and profit/loss forecasts

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-4
fields.infoText:
**Financial solvency details**, including:





- bankruptcy or insolvency proceedings for your company’s assets in the last 3 years


- evidence of financial standing over the last 3 years, such as letter from auditors or a copy of finalised accounts


- if established in last 3 years, provide latest cash flow, balance sheet and profit and loss forecasts approved by directors, partners, sole proprietor - upload in PDF or jpeg (5MB maximum)


- anything which could impact on solvency in the foreseeable future


- any Duty Deferment Account

[C118-6-1](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-6-part-1/nonagent?gac=320ff94f-7a95-4c27-bc3a-6e3cbb1c1c69) - Site and goods security, safety requirements, risk and threat assessments, external security providers

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-6-1
fields.infoText:
**Security and safety requirements, assessments and plans, and standards and authorisation details**, including:





- your risk and threat assessment, and your security plan


- how you implement and coordinate security measures across sites


- how you document and communicate security instructions to staff and visitors


- security incidents, and how you’ve mitigated them for the future


- if you are certified, authorised or approved for security purposes


- standards, licences or authorisations you follow


- safety and security requirements of goods


- safety and security requirements that customers or insurers impose on you


- if you use a security company and if they have found risks

[C118-6-2](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-6-part-2/nonagent?gac=7f548ac8-b1bb-4d41-8acf-f0562bd7a9ab) - Building and boundary security, access to premises and parking

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-6-2
fields.infoText:
**Building security and access to your premises details**, including:





- how the external boundary is secured, and how this is checked and recorded


- how access to the premises is managed and restricted


- how the premises are illuminated


- how keys are administered and documented


- what parking is allowed and who approves


- whether vehicles are checked at the entrance, and if you have written regulations


- how access to premises is regulated and checked for staff, visitors, vehicles and goods


- what providers exist for if an unauthorised person or vehicle is discovered


- how these procedures are communicated to staff


- details of colocated companies on your premises

[C118-6-3](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-6-part-3/nonagent?gac=7c5a1de5-6c14-4c1a-b6fa-691c349da292) - Cargo storage, goods sealing and marking, security checks, loading and transportation

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-6-3
fields.infoText:
**Cargo storage, sealing and marking goods, security and checks on incoming goods, and stocktaking
loading and transportation details**, including:





- how you restrict access to cargo units, seal and stop tampering with them


- who owns or operates the units, and how they are maintained


- how you transport goods, and ensure security standards if you use external providers


- how you make sure incoming goods are secure


- how you inform employees about security arrangements with suppliers


- how incoming goods are sealed and marked, counted, weighed and checked against documents


- how you separate purchase, receipt and general admin sections


- what areas you have set aside goods storage, and how they are used


- how you store and record different risk goods


- how you document stocktaking and procedures for dealing with irregularities


- if storage is outsourced, where goods are stored


- how and where goods are produced, and how kept secure


- how goods are packed and loaded, and whether there are written procedures


- how you meet customer security requirements for loading


- how you seal and keep a record of outgoing vehicles


- how you check outgoing goods for completeness and recorded


- what controls you have for detecting irregularities in loading

[C118-6-4](https://www.govforms.io/submissions/new-form/hmrc-C118-apply-for-authorised-economic-operator-section-6-part-4/nonagent?gac=7992cd1d-21b3-454c-98c1-6702c5e7b2e4) - Employee security and training, partners and external services

fields.label: Read about what you'll need to complete C118-6-4
fields.infoText:
**Security of employees, partners and external services details**, including:





- how you verify the identity of trade partners to secure the supply chain 


- how you confirm that your partners ensure the security of their part of chain


- any you’ve had breaches over the last year, and the measures you’ve introduced since


- how your employment policy deals with security and safety requirements


- how you security check new staff, and existing staff transferring into sensitive areas


- how you check leaving staff so they have no physical or electronic access to company premises or data


- how you train employees in security and safety, including refreshers and written records


- how temps are checked regularly according to security standards


- whether temp staff have security instructions


- if you use external services under contract, such as security guards


- what written agreements on security requirements you have with these external services

sections.title: Apply for both AEO customs simplification and AEO security and safety

fields.infoText:
You need to complete all of the forms on this page.  
 
We save your progress for **28 days**, starting from when you select the first link.  
 
When you are ready, you must submit all forms at the same time.

fields.label: Tips to complete your application
fields.infoText:
To help you submit and get your information right first time:
- you can start and save any form in any order
- authorised people in your business can work on different forms at the same time, using the same Government Gateway ID and password. 
- do not to submit your first form until you are ready to submit everything

[C117](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology) - 

**About the business**, including:


- All business addresses, including where you keep customs identification and documentation


- Legal registration number


- VAT registered number





**About the people**, including:


- Name, address and email of person responsible for customs matters


- Name, position, telephone number and email of designated contact person


- Name, address, position, date of birth and National Insurance number for person in charge of company or control of management contact





- You will need National Insurance numbers for UK nationals, and residential addresses for non-UK nationals.





**About the business activity**, including:


- EU member states, ports and customs offices you use to import, export, or transit goods


- Simplifications or facilitations your business has, with the type, code, authorisation numbers, plus any certificates


- Upload audited accounts for last 3 years of trading - PDF or jpeg (5MB maximum)

[C118-1-1](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology) - 


**Business information details**, including





- Any AEO authorisation or current audits of other companies in your group

- If your company was established in the last 3 years from internal reorganisation

- Who is responsible for customs matters, their name and National Insurance number, orate of birth if non-UK national

- Company locations, including employee numbers and business activity

- Any third party locations where outsourced work takes place

- Internal organisation structure and responsibilities of each department
[C118-1-2](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology) - Volume of business, annual turnover and accounts, declarations estimates, duty and VAT
[C118-1-3](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology) - Customs formalities, tariff classifications, value and certification, plus anti-dumping or countervailing duties
[C118-2](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology) - Compliance record, convictions and customs authorisation

[C118-3-1](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology) - Audit trail, internal control system, flow of goods, stocktaking checks, recent customs routes audit report

Upload a recent customs routes audit report - PDF or jpeg (5MB maximum)
[C118-3-2](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology) -  Customs routines, computer system back-up and protection, security documentation and compliance

[C118-4](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology) - Financial solvency and standing, Duty Deferment accounts, approved cash flow, balance sheet and profit/loss forecasts

If established in last 3 years, provide latest cash flow, balance sheet and profit and loss forecasts approved by directors, partners, sole proprietor - upload in PDF or jpeg (5MB maximum)
[C118-5](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology) - Customs competence expert, their professional qualifications, training and European Standardisation compliance
[C118-6-1](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology) - Site and goods security, safety requirements, risk and threat assessments, external security providers
[C118-6-2](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology) - Building and boundary security, access to premises and parking
[C118-6-3](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology) - Cargo storage, goods sealing and marking, security checks, loading and transportation
[C118-6-4](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology) - Employee security and training, partners and external services

fields.label: Provide details below of who is signing the declaration
First name
fields.errorMessage: First name can only include letters a to z, numbers, spaces, hyphens and apostrophes

fields.label: Last name
fields.errorMessage: Last name can only include letters a to z, numbers, spaces, hyphens and apostrophes

fields.label: Status
fields.helpText: For example, director, financial controller or secretary
fields.errorMessage: Position in the company can only include letters, numbers, spaces, hyphens and apostrophes

fields.label: To receive confirmation that your return has been submitted, enter an email address below
Email address
fields.errorMessage: Enter a valid email address with no spaces, like name@example.com

fields.infoText: This is your last opportunity to print or save a pdf copy of your submitted form.

fields.label: Payment
